newsitem.title: USA: United Wisconsin Services Q3 net off.
newsitem.headline: United Wisconsin Services Q3 net off.

text.p: (All Data Above 000s Except Per Share Numbers)
NOTE: Q3 results include realized investment gains of $0.06/shr vs $0.27/shr. Before gains, shr $0.28 vs $0.23.
(All Data Above 000s Except Per Share Numbers)
NOTE: Nine-month results include realized investment gains of $0.31/shr vs $0.37/shr.
Upon completion of the merger, Samuel Miller, executive vice president of United Wisconsin, will become president and chief executive officer of American Medical Security.

United Wisconsin earlier Tuesday reported third quarter earnings, including realized investment gains, of $0.34 per share compared with $0.50 per share. Excluding realized investment gains, earnings were $0.28 per share compared with $0.23 per share.

The company said Small Group PPO Products sold by American Medical Security reported a pretax loss for the third quarter of 1996 totaling $800,000. A pretax gain of $1.0 million was recorded in the third quarter of 1995.
Premiums on American Medical Security Small Group PPO health products for the 1996 third quarter increased six percent to $130.3 million from $122.9 million for the 1995 third quarter.
